intro: Adenosma caerulea var. urticifolia, commonly known as blue antelope plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers. The plant typically grows in shrubland and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are hairy and have a distinctive stinging sensation when touched, similar to nettle leaves. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique floral display.
